thread.title: Cubs' Addison Russell to have MRI Tuesday on "tight" hamstring
thread.title_full: Cubs' Addison Russell to have MRI Tuesday on "tight" hamstring | Chicago Sun-Times

title: Cubs' Addison Russell to have MRI Tuesday on "tight" hamstring
text:
Cub rookie shortstop Addison Russell’s status for the rest of the postseason is in doubt after he left Monday’s division series game with “tightness” in his left hamstring after legging out a triple in the fourth inning.
He was scheduled to have an MRI before Tuesday’s Game 4 of the best-of-five series against the Cardinals. The team considers him a day-to-day decision.
“We are absolutely not certain what the severity is,” manager Joe Maddon said after the game.
Javy Baez, who took over at short for Russell (and delivered a pair of hits), would be available to start today as the Cubs try to close out the series.
Russell, who was slow out of the box on the line drive to the wall in left, seemed to extend as he accelerated rounding second and left the game with the trainer after sliding into third.
Russell, who downplayed the seriousness after the game, said he felt the hamstring “grab” as he rounded second.
“After that, I just wanted to be cautious,” he said. “I didn’t want to put us in a sticky situation at shortstop. I thought it would be better to go out.”
Russell, who has had two right hamstring injuries in his career said, “This was nothing like those.”
